translations.Failed to delete the server configuratio: Failed to delete the server configuration
translations.Invalid configuration: Anonymous binding: Invalid configuration: Anonymous binding is not allowed.
Valid configuration, but binding failed. Please check the server settings and credentials.
translations.Invalid configuration. Please have a loo: Invalid configuration. Please have a look at the logs for further details.
translations.The Base DN appears to be wrong: The Base DN appears to be wrong
translations.Please check the credentials, they seem: Please check the credentials, they seem to be wrong.
translations.Please specify the port, it could not be: Please specify the port, it could not be auto-detected.
translations.Base DN could not be auto-detected, plea: Base DN could not be auto-detected, please revise credentials, host and port.
translations.Could not detect Base DN, please enter i: Could not detect Base DN, please enter it manually.
translations.No object found in the given Base DN. Pl: No object found in the given Base DN. Please revise.
_{objectsFound} entry available within t: {objectsFound} entry available within the provided Base DN
{objectsFound} entries available within the provided Base DN
translations.An error occurred. Please check the Base: An error occurred. Please check the Base DN, as well as connection settings and credentials.
translations.Do you really want to delete the current: Do you really want to delete the current Server Configuration?
translations.Anonymous bind is not allowed. Please pr: Anonymous bind is not allowed. Please provide a User DN and Password.
translations.LDAP Operations error. Anonymous bind mi: LDAP Operations error. Anonymous bind might not be allowed.
translations.Saving failed. Please make sure the data: Saving failed. Please make sure the database is in operation. Reload before continuing.
translations.Switching the mode will enable automatic: Switching the mode will enable automatic LDAP queries. Depending on your LDAP size they may take a while. Do you still want to switch the mode?
translations.User not found. Please check your login: User not found. Please check your login attributes and username. Effective filter (to copy-and-paste for command-line validation):
translations.Consider narrowing your search, as it en: Consider narrowing your search, as it encompassed many users, only the first one of whom will be able to log in.
translations.An unspecified error occurred. Please ch: An unspecified error occurred. Please check log and settings.
translations.The search filter is invalid, probably d: The search filter is invalid, probably due to syntax issues like an uneven number of opened and closed brackets. Please revise.
translations.A connection error to LDAP / AD occurred: A connection error to LDAP / AD occurred, please check host, port and credentials.
translations.The \"%uid\" placeholder is missing. It: The "%uid" placeholder is missing. It will be replaced with the login name when querying LDAP / AD.
translations.Please provide a login name to test agai: Please provide a login name to test against
translations.The group box was disabled, because the: The group box was disabled, because the LDAP / AD server does not support memberOf.
translations.Please login with the new password: Please login with the new password
_Your password will expire within %n day: Your password will expire within %n day.
Your password will expire within %n days.
translations.Could not detect user display name attri: Could not detect user display name attribute. Please specify it yourself in advanced LDAP settings.
translations.Could not find the desired feature: Could not find the desired feature
translations.Groups meeting these criteria are availa: Groups meeting these criteria are available in %s:
translations.The filter specifies which LDAP groups s: The filter specifies which LDAP groups shall have access to the %s instance.
translations.Verify settings and count the groups: Verify settings and count the groups
translations.When logging in, %s will find the user b: When logging in, %s will find the user based on the following attributes:
translations.Allows login against the LDAP / AD usern: Allows login against the LDAP / AD username, which is either "uid" or "sAMAccountName" and will be detected.
Allows login against an email attribute. "mail" and "mailPrimaryAddress" allowed.
translations.Defines the filter to apply, when login: Defines the filter to apply, when login is attempted. "%%uid" replaces the username in the login action. Example: "uid=%%uid"
translations.Copy current configuration into new dire: Copy current configuration into new directory binding
translations.You can omit the protocol, unless you re: You can omit the protocol, unless you require SSL. If so, start with ldaps://
translations.The DN of the client user with which the: The DN of the client user with which the bind shall be done, e.g. uid=agent,dc=example,dc=com. For anonymous access, leave DN and Password empty.
translations.For anonymous access, leave DN and Passw: For anonymous access, leave DN and Password empty.
translations.You can specify Base DN for users and gr: You can specify Base DN for users and groups in the Advanced tab
translations.Avoids automatic LDAP requests. Better f: Avoids automatic LDAP requests. Better for bigger setups, but requires some LDAP knowledge.
translations.Manually enter LDAP filters (recommended: Manually enter LDAP filters (recommended for large directories)
translations.Listing and searching for users is const: Listing and searching for users is constrained by these criteria:
translations.The most common object classes for users: The most common object classes for users are organizationalPerson, person, user, and inetOrgPerson. If you are not sure which object class to select, please consult your directory admin.
translations.The filter specifies which LDAP users sh: The filter specifies which LDAP users shall have access to the %s instance.
translations.Please try again or contact your adminis: Please try again or contact your administrator.
translations.<b>Warning:</b> The PHP LDAP module is n: Warning: The PHP LDAP module is not installed, the backend will not work. Please ask your system administrator to install it.
translations.When unchecked, this configuration will: When unchecked, this configuration will be skipped.
translations.Give an optional backup host. It must be: Give an optional backup host. It must be a replica of the main LDAP/AD server.
Only connect to the replica server.
translations.Not recommended, use it for testing only: Not recommended, use it for testing only! If connection only works with this option, import the LDAP server's SSL certificate in your %s server.
in seconds. A change empties the cache.
translations.The LDAP attribute to use to generate th: The LDAP attribute to use to generate the user's display name.
translations.Optional. An LDAP attribute to be added: Optional. An LDAP attribute to be added to the display name in brackets. Results in e.g. »John Doe (john.doe@example.org)«.
translations.One User Base DN per line: One User Base DN per line
translations.The LDAP attribute to use to generate th: The LDAP attribute to use to generate the group's display name.
translations.One Group Base DN per line: One Group Base DN per line
translations.The LDAP attribute that on group objects: The LDAP attribute that on group objects contains an LDAP search URL that determines what objects belong to the group. (An empty setting disables dynamic group membership functionality.)
translations.When switched on, groups that contain gr: When switched on, groups that contain groups are supported. (Only works if the group member attribute contains DNs.)
translations.Chunksize used for paged LDAP searches t: Chunksize used for paged LDAP searches that may return bulky results like user or group enumeration. (Setting it 0 disables paged LDAP searches in those situations.)
translations.Enable LDAP password changes per user: Enable LDAP password changes per user
translations.Allow LDAP users to change their passwor: Allow LDAP users to change their password and allow Super Administrators and Group Administrators to change the password of their LDAP users. Only works when access control policies are configured accordingly on the LDAP server. As passwords are sent in plaintext to the LDAP server, transport encryption must be used and password hashing should be configured on the LDAP server.
translations.(New password is sent as plain text to L: (New password is sent as plain text to LDAP)
translations.The DN of a default password policy that: The DN of a default password policy that will be used for password expiry handling. Works only when LDAP password changes per user are enabled and is only supported by OpenLDAP. Leave empty to disable password expiry handling.
translations.Leave empty for user's default quota. Ot: Leave empty for user's default quota. Otherwise, specify an LDAP/AD attribute.
translations.Override default quota for LDAP users wh: Override default quota for LDAP users who do not have a quota set in the Quota Field.
translations.Set the user's email from their LDAP att: Set the user's email from their LDAP attribute. Leave it empty for default behaviour.
translations.Leave empty for user name (default). Oth: Leave empty for user name (default). Otherwise, specify an LDAP/AD attribute.
translations.By default the internal username will be: By default the internal username will be created from the UUID attribute. It makes sure that the username is unique and characters do not need to be converted. The internal username has the restriction that only these characters are allowed: [ a-zA-Z0-9_.@- ]. Other characters are replaced with their ASCII correspondence or simply omitted. On collisions a number will be added/increased. The internal username is used to identify a user internally. It is also the default name for the user home folder. It is also a part of remote URLs, for instance for all *DAV services. With this setting, the default behavior can be overridden. Leave it empty for default behavior. Changes will have effect only on newly mapped (added) LDAP users.
translations.By default, the UUID attribute is automa: By default, the UUID attribute is automatically detected. The UUID attribute is used to unambiguously identify LDAP users and groups. Also, the internal username will be created based on the UUID, if not specified otherwise above. You can override the setting and pass an attribute of your choice. You must make sure that the attribute of your choice can be fetched for both users and groups and it is unique. Leave it empty for default behaviour. Changes will have effect only on newly mapped (added) LDAP users and groups.
translations.Usernames are used to store and assign (: Usernames are used to store and assign (meta) data. In order to precisely identify and recognise users, each LDAP user will have an internal username. This requires a mapping from username to LDAP user. The created username is mapped to the UUID of the LDAP user. Additionally the DN is cached as well to reduce LDAP interaction, but it is not used for identification. If the DN changes, the changes will be found. The internal username is used all over. Clearing the mappings will have leftovers everywhere. Clearing the mappings is not configuration sensitive, it affects all LDAP configurations! Never clear the mappings in a production environment, only in a testing or experimental stage.
translations.entries available within the provided B: entries available within the provided Base DN
translations.<b>Warning:</b> Apps user_ldap and user_: Warning: Apps user_ldap and user_webdavauth are incompatible. You may experience unexpected behavior. Please ask your system administrator to disable one of them.
